author: Ground News
title: Ground News - 'He would be so proud'; Concordia guard Emily Beseman taking memories of her late father into NCAA tournament
text: 'He would be so proud'; Concordia guard Emily Beseman taking memories of her late father into NCAA tournament Tom Beseman was a beloved figure in the small town of Swanville, Minnesota. Tom passed away last summer after a seven-year battle with Leukemia. The Cobbers honored Tommy's Legacy at a game last month. They've only lost twice since then, and used a hisotric season to help them heal. Summary by Ground News 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right [] Inforum 'He would be so proud'; Concordia guard Emily Beseman taking memories of her late father into NCAA tournament MOORHEAD Emily Beseman’s dad Tom rarely missed a game.“When I started playing C team, I think sixth or seventh grade, he was the C team coach, a JV coach," Emily said. "He has always been there throughout my high school career."Emily and her Mom Theresa told me all about Tom sitting in the same spot, and making his presence felt - and heard - during her college games at Concordia.This season has been different, though.
